intro: Artanthe grandifolia, commonly known as the giant artanthe, is a striking perennial plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its large, showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly fuzzy texture. Artanthe grandifolia thrives in full sun to partial shade and is well-suited for rock gardens or as a border plant.
